Moves

Class Move

  • java.lang.Object
    • Moves.Move

  • public class Move
extends java.lang.Object
    A public class providing facilities for validating and executing moves
    Author:
    Daniele Palazzo

    • Constructor Detail

      • Move

        public Move(Tile from,
            Tile to,
            ChessBoard board)
        Constructs and initialises a Move object
        Parameters:
        from - The tile to move a piece from
        to - The tile to move a piece to
        board - The board on which the move should happen

    • Method Detail

      • executeMove

        public void executeMove()
                 throws MoveNotPossible
        Validates the move and executes it if it is legal
        Throws:
        MoveNotPossible - This is thrown if the move is not possible (illegal)

      • isMovePossible

        public boolean isMovePossible()
        Validates moves
        Returns:
        Returns true if the move is legal

        Return the "to" tile coordinate

      • getMoveType

        public java.lang.String getMoveType()
        Get the move type (e.g. PawnMove or BishopMove)
        Returns:
        Returns a string representing the move type (e.g. PawnMove or BishopMove)

      • convertToLongAlgebraic

        private void convertToLongAlgebraic()
        Determines the move's long algebraic notation form and stores it in the longAlgebraicNotation member variable

      • getLongAlgebraicNotation

        public java.lang.String getLongAlgebraicNotation()
        Gets the long algebraic notation of the move
        Returns:
        Returns a string of long algebraic notation representing the move

      • getTakenPiece

        public Piece getTakenPiece()
        Gets the taken piece if any (this is useful for undoing the move)
        Returns:
        Returns the Piece that was taken with the current move

      • isFirstMove

        public boolean isFirstMove()
        Determines whether this was the first move for the piece (only works with Rook, King and Pawn)
        Returns:
        Returns true if this move was a first move for the moving piece (only works with Rook, King and Pawn)

      • wasPawnPromotion

        public boolean wasPawnPromotion()
        Determines whether or not the move was a pawn promotion (this is useful for undoing the move)
        Returns:
        Returns true if the move was a pawn promotion

      • setPromotionPiece

        public void setPromotionPiece(char pieceNotation)
        Sets the promotion piece manually (Promotion dialog doesn't have to be opened - useful for engine promotion)
        Parameters:
        pieceNotation - A character representing the piece that was selected for promotion
